title: Explore data in the Global Integrated Power Tracker
footer: All data comes from GEM's [Global Integrated Power Tracker](https://globalenergymonitor.org/projects/global-integrated-power-tracker/), last updated in September 2024. Units on this page are in gigawatts (GW).  Under development includes all capacity with status announced, pre-permit, permitted, and construction.

dropdown.overall_summary: Wind, solar and hydropower make up nearly two-thirds of capacity under construction in Canada.
France has no fossil-fuelled power projects in development.
Around three-quarters of capacity under construction in Germany is wind and solar.
Oil and gas plants constitute the largest source of capacity under construction in Italy.
Oil and gas plants constitute the largest source of capacity under construction in Japan.
The United States has more than **five times** as much non-fossil power in construction than fossil fuel capacity.
The UK has 14 GW of non-fossil energy under construction, with two-thirds of it wind power.
